s.text: Kingsolver's latest is hailed as a step forward in maturity and scope.

"Corpus Christi has all the power of a slap across the face with a limp lettuce leaf" (Jennifer Harper, the Washington Times ). Contrary to expectations, the play is neither lascivious nor particularly blasphemous.
2) The plot is hard to follow if you haven't read the book.
3) The film is too literal an interpretation of a book whose very essence is obliqueness and indirection.

They also praise the film's "flair," "wit," and willingness to make fun of itself (Leonard Klady, Daily Variety ). (Visit "Chucky's Toybox," an unofficial fan site that has film clips, pictures, news, and a message board all about Chucky.)
